page.title: 04Flitwick Watermill
page.content:
History of Flitwick Mill
The Mill at Flitwick is one of 6 which lay on the River Flit. There are records of a Mill on this site since the 1085 Domesday. It was originally built by the Monks of Dunstable Priory. They built an artificial channel deeper and wider than the main course of the river to augment its speed and power. In 1711 John Goodman rented the Mill and his son Richard bought the Mill in 1731. It is still in the possession of the Goodman family. The house was altered during thee early 19th and 20th centuries and one wall contains the date 1822.
